subprocess_flow.description: The Product Owner and Development Team review action items from the Sprint Retrospective to ensure they are being addressed and incorporated into the backlog refinement process. This ensures continuous improvement based on past sprint experiences.
success_criteria: Action items from the Sprint Retrospective are reviewed and understood.

subprocess_flow.description: The Product Owner analyzes user feedback collected from various sources (e.g., Sprint Reviews, user surveys, support tickets) to identify new requirements, pain points, and areas for improvement. This ensures that the backlog reflects the latest user needs and expectations.
success_criteria: User feedback is analyzed and documented.

subprocess_flow.description: Based on the analyzed user feedback and business priorities, the Product Owner identifies and drafts new user stories to be added to the Product Backlog. These user stories should clearly define the desired functionality and the value they provide.
success_criteria: New user stories are drafted and added to the Product Backlog.

subprocess_flow.description: The Product Owner and Development Team collaborate to add details to the existing and newly drafted user stories, including acceptance criteria, mockups, and any other relevant information. This ensures that the user stories are well-defined and ready for estimation.
success_criteria: User stories have clear descriptions and acceptance criteria.

subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team estimates the effort required to implement the detailed user stories, using techniques such as story points or t-shirt sizing. This provides a basis for prioritizing the user stories and planning future sprints.
success_criteria: All user stories have effort estimates assigned.

subprocess_flow.description: The Product Owner re-prioritizes the Product Backlog based on the estimated effort, business value, and any other relevant factors. This ensures that the most valuable user stories are at the top of the backlog and ready for implementation in the next sprint.
success_criteria: User stories are ranked in order of priority.

subprocess_flow.description: The Development Team identifies any dependencies between user stories or with external systems, and documents them in the Product Backlog. This helps to avoid delays and ensure a smooth development process.

The Product Owner and Development Team review the refined Product Backlog to ensure that it is up-to-date, well-organized, and ready for Sprint Planning. This is the final check before the next sprint planning meeting.
success_criteria: The product backlog is ready for sprint planning.
